results.title: Two worlds: one me
results.creator_credit: Elinor Moshe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Born in Israel during the Gulf War but eventually moving to Australia, Elinor Moshe finds herself caught between two countries, cultures and traditions.

results.title: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010

video_links.name: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010

results.brief_description: Oscar winning animation director and writer Adam Elliot speaks candidly about his stop frame animation processes and, more importantly, about why he makes films. Adam also talks about the challenges he faced during the making of his first feature film ‘Mary and Max’.
results.title_for_label: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010

results.title: Spectacle: Interview with Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Shelley Matulick and ACMI

video_links.name: Spectacle: Interview with Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells

results.brief_description:
“How many exhibitions would have the range of Bob Dylan to Kanye West?” (Jonathan Wells)
Flux Curators Jonathan Wells and Meg Grey Wells share what inspired ‘Spectacle: The Music Video Exhibition’, the challenges in bringing over 300 clips into an exhibition context and their favourite areas in the exhibition.
Created as part of ‘Spectacle: The Music Video Exhibition’ 26 September 2013 - 23 February 2014.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Shelley Matulick and ACMI

results.title: Round and around
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Produced for use in primary schools to stimulate interest in Melbourne’s annual Royal Agricultural Show. Shows without commentary all the hectic activity of displays, sideshows and the excitement of the Grand Parade.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: Applause please
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund
results.brief_description: This film makes a personal statement on TV and commercial advertising and their insidious effect on the susceptibility of people. The message is given using an avant-garde style, told in mime and dramatics. Cast includes Max Gillies, Joe Bolza and Bob Thorneycroft and original music performed by Frank Zappa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund

results.title: Afghanistan, Pushtun people: making felt
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how women of the Pushtun tribe make felt mats for their families and for decorating the hard floor of their black camel-hair tents. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Building a bridge: Tajik
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how, in three days of actual construction, one hundred Tajik men and boys from one village work together to rebuild their hand-construction bridge. No narration.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: Boys' game: Pushtu nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows an ancient game, well-known in Asia, being played by Pushtu boys. Demonstrates the toughness of the young men and the value these tribal people place on physical superiority. Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Gel
results.creator_credit: Ralph Henderson, Eric White and Films Sagittaire
results.brief_description: Produced for the Davis Gelatine company, the film uses a domestic science student to outline some of the properties and uses of gelatine. Various examples of modern gelatine cookery are also shown.
